Context and background:
The Scottish Government expect schools in Scotland to introduce the 1+2 Modern Languages policy, i.e. all pupils from Primary 1 (pupils aged 5) will begin to learn a modern foreign language  and a second language from Primary 5 (pupils aged 9).
Fife Council - our local authority - set up a group of 40 pilot schools to implement the 1 + 2 policy in different clusters across the region - in towns, in areas of deprivation and in rural areas in order to get a balanced representation of all schools in the authority. 

Objectives of the project: 
Our school has volunteered to be one of these pilot schools . Our highest priority and main objective  is to increase our teacher's competence and boost confidence in delivering exposure to Modern Languages. 

Number/Profile of Participants
After a presentation and selection process 4 of our teachers were identified as having a clear need to increase their language skills to allow them to gain greater confidence in delivering languages as part of the new curriculum.

Description of Activities:
To complement the training provided by the local authority, the 4 teachers will take part in  language immersion activities in France and Spain.  The course content has been adapted to meet the needs of our teachers provided - language teaching methodology in Early Years Education combined with gaining enhanced skills in the target language, therefore boosting confidence in speaking the target language.

Methodology to be used:
As head teacher I have identified with my teachers their development needs and looked for  high quality providers to run immersion courses abroad in conjunction with the Institut Francais and the Consejeria de Educacion
Together we have developed the course content to the specific needs of our teachers' requirements in line with advice for the new national curriculum in Scotland.
As head teacher I will monitor the experience of the course - there will be an evaluation of participants by the course provider
and a evaluation of course  by participants:
Through the evaluation of the course and the subsequent interview with each participating teacher I expect to get a clear picture of how successful / effective the course was.

Description of results/impact envisaged:
As head teacher I expect  longer term benefits as we are looking forward to our teachers becoming more fluent and more confident in their understanding and talking of the target language. Our pupils will greatly benefit from an enthused teacher who is able to speak accurately in the target language and will learn about foreign cultures first hand.

The project is to undertake a LFEE immersion course in French, in France.  The objectives for undertaking this activity are to extend the language skills of the lead teacher to enable more thorough support to colleagues.  The acquisition of more up to date and effective teaching methods in Moder Foreign Languages.   To develop progression in teaching MFL to ensure it is embedded in the curriculum throughout the learner's experiences from Nursery to Secondary Transition.  To incorporate ICT skills into learning and communication experiences for better learning.  To identify ways in which opportunities for Global and European experiences can enhance learning. As a result  of this activity all staff, teachers and support staff as well as interested colleagues in the cluster schools will be upskilled by feedback on new methodology and new resources to improve teaching and learning experiences.  All children from Nursery to Secondary Transition will benefit from better skills progression and more effective learning experiences.  The pupils, staff,parents, carers and other community partners to our school will have access to a wider real life dimension to teaching and learning in Europe through new activities.  In particular this course will offer confidence to teachers and pupils in using ICT skills to communicate with others in real life exchanges with schools in France. This immersion course offers the opportunity for learning alongside teachers from other European countries and this face to face experience is invaluable for sharing and broadening the cultural experiences beyond the classroom for teachers and pupils. The short term impact of this course will be on the school staff who will have access through the participant to new methods, skills and resources for teaching within their own classes.  Evaluating these will lead to improvements in the curriculum integration, coverage and progression throughout the school.   In the longer term methods and skills will be applied to the teaching of other Moder Foreign Languages in the school and similar experiences in other countries will be sought and shared with all stakeholders.
